snippet: Uli Hoeness, the president of one of the world’s top soccer clubs and one of Germany’s most popular figures, received a sentence of three and a half years in jail.
abstract: Uli Hoeness, the president of the European champion soccer club Bayern Munich, is convicted of tax evasion and sentenced to three and a half years in prison after a four-day trial that consumed Germany, dominating nation's media.
lead_paragraph: Uli Hoeness, the president of one of the world’s top soccer clubs and one of Germany’s most popular figures, received a sentence of three and a half years in jail.

headline.main: Bayern Munich’s Hoeness Sentenced to Prison for Tax Evasion
